org.aion.api

Interface IContractController


  • public interface IContractController
    This interface provides methods for deploy the contract to the Aion blockchain network, store the contract into the contract container, retrieve the contract and remove the contract.
    Author:
    Jay Tseng

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • createFromSource

        ApiMsg createFromSource(java.lang.String source,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        long nrgLimit,
                        long nrgPrice)
        Multiple contract create methods for deploy contracts on the Aion network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        A multi-contract source, set key value pair when you want to deploy the contract "key" with initial parameters "value"

      • createFromSource

        ApiMsg createFromSource(java.lang.String source,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        long nrgLimit,
                        long nrgPrice,
                        java.math.BigInteger value)
        Multiple contract create methods for deploy contracts on the Aion network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        value - the class BigInteger represent how many balance of the the sender's account want to send during this deploy.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        A multi-contract source, set key value pair when you want to deploy the contract "key" with initial parameters "value"

      • createFromSource

        ApiMsg createFromSource(java.lang.String source,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        long nrgLimit,
                        long nrgPrice,
                        java.util.List<ISolidityArg> params)
        contract create method for deploy a contract with initial arguments on the Aion network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        params - the interface List of the interface ISolidityArg represent the contract constructor arguments when the contract has the constructor.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        A multi-contract source, set key value pair when you want to deploy the contract "key" with initial parameters "value"

      • createFromSource

        ApiMsg createFromSource(java.lang.String source,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        long nrgLimit,
                        long nrgPrice,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<ISolidityArg>> params)
        contract create method for deploy contracts with initial arguments on the Aion network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        params - the interface Map of the pair of the class String and the interface ISolidityArg represent the contract name and the constructor arguments when the contract has the constructor.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address)

                        long nrgLimit,

                        java.math.BigInteger value,
                        java.util.List<ISolidityArg> params)
        Multiple contract create methods for deploy a contract to the Aion blockchain network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        value - the class BigInteger represent how many blanceof the the sender's account want to send during this deploy.
        params - the interface List of the interface ISolidityArg represent the contract constructor arguments when the contract has the constructor.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:

      • createFromSource

        ApiMsg createFromSource(java.lang.String source,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        long nrgLimit,
                        long nrgPrice,
                        java.math.BigInteger value,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<ISolidityArg>> params)
        Multiple contract create methods for deploy a contract to the Aion blockchain network.
        Parameters:
        source - the class String represent the contract source code. It could be multiple contracts.
        from - the class Address represent the sender or the contract owner whom deploy the contract.
        nrgLimit - the long value represent the maximum energy consume during this contract deploy been allowed. if the contract consume energy more than this number. the deploy will fail, Also the contract deployer will been charged all of the energy for trying to deploy this contract.
        nrgPrice - the long value represent the unit price of the energy the contract deployer want to pay. It effect the contract deploy response time by the current network environment.
        value - the class BigInteger represent how many blanceof the the sender's account want to send during this deploy.
        params - the interface Map of the pair of the class String and the interface ISolidityArg represent the contract name and the constructor arguments when the contract has the constructor.
        Returns:
        the the deploy status wrapped into ApiMsg. The deployed contract will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address
        See Also:
        A multi-contract source, set key value pair when you want to deploy the contract "key" with initial parameters "value"

      • getContractAt

        IContract getContractAt(org.aion.base.type.Address from,
                        org.aion.base.type.Address contract,
                        java.lang.String abi)
        create a contract object by given the sender, the deployed contract address on the Aion network, and the solidity abi definition for the contract. And store into the controller.
        Parameters:
        from - the class Address represent the sender whom want to interact with the contract.
        contract - the class Address represent the contract address.
        abi - the class String represent the contract Abi definition.
        Returns:
        the class IContract represent the contract been created in the contractController. The created contract object will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address)

      • getContract

        IContract getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address contractAddr)
        retrieve the contract by given the contract address.
        Parameters:
        contractAddr - the class Address represent the contract address.
        Returns:
        the class IContract represent the contract been stored inside the contractController.
        See Also:
        getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address)

      • getContract

        java.util.List<IContract> getContract(java.lang.String contractName)
        retrieve the contractList by given the contract name.
        Parameters:
        contractName - the class String represent the contract address.
        Returns:
        the interface List of the class IContract represent the contract been stored inside the contractController. the user could deploy same contract multiple times. Therefore the return will be a list of the IContract.
        See Also:
        getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address)

      • getContract

        IContract getContract()
        retrieve the first contract inside the ContractController
        Returns:
        the the contract create status wrapped into ApiMsg. The created contract object will been store inside the Controller and user can retrieve it by given the contract address.
        See Also:
        getContract(org.aion.base.type.Address)

      • getContractList

        java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<org.aion.base.type.Address,java.lang.String>> getContractList()
        retrieve all of the pair of the contract address and the contract name inside the ContractController.
        Returns:
        the interface List of the interface Map.Entry of the pair of the pair of the Class Address and the class String represent the contract address and the contract name.

      • remove

        ApiMsg remove(IContract c)
        remove contract by given the contract object from ContractController.
        Parameters:
        c - the interface IContract represent the contract object.
        Returns:
        the boolean value represent the status of the operation wrapped by the class ApiMsg. You can retrieve through getObject.

      • clear

        void clear()
        remove all contracts from the ContractController.
